com.iKairos.TrafficSim

Class Network.Lane

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iKairos.TrafficSim.Network.Lane
  • Enclosing class:
    Network

    public static class Network.Lane
extends java.lang.Object
    This represents a lane
    Theoretically, an edge can have 1 or more Lanes.
    It is in lanes that vehicles are held.

    The way vehicles are queried should be carefully thought out because cars will be polling the cars collection of each lane very often (about twice every second), so this polling must be computationally very efficient
    Author:
    Nimrod

    • Method Detail

      • getLeadingVehicle

        public Agents.Vehicle getLeadingVehicle(Agents.Vehicle vehicle)
        Gets the leading vehicle.
        Parameters:
        vehicle - The Vehicle requesting the services of this method
        Returns:
        The vehicle ahead of requester in this lane, null if the requester is the leading vehicle on the lane. Client code should appropriately handle the null response.

      • insertVehicle

        public void insertVehicle(Agents.Vehicle vehicle)
        Inserts a vehicle into the lane, and sets the currentLane property of the vehicle to this lane.
        Every vehicle is created ready to be inserted at position 0.0 of the lane
        Parameters:
        vehicle - The vehicle to insert

      • removeVehicle

        public void removeVehicle()
        This removes the vehicle at the front of the queue of vehicles in this lane
        This should be called by a vehicle when it has reached the end of the lane.

      • removeVehicle

        public void removeVehicle(Agents.Vehicle vehicle)
        This removes a vehicle at any position from the lane.
        Should be called by vehicles changing lane
        Parameters:
        vehicle - The vehicle to remove from the lane

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Gets the id.
        Returns:
        the id

      • setParentEdge

        public void setParentEdge(Network.Edge parent)
        Sets the parent edge of the lane.
        Should be called at the time at which the lane is added to an Edge
        A lane is just as long as its parent edge
        Parameters:
        parent - The Edge to which this lane has been added.

      • getLength

        public double getLength()
        Gets the length.
        Returns:
        The length of the lane
